sentence.text: Group 1 pulmonary hypertension or pulmonary arterial hypertension (L-phenylalanine catabolic process) is a rare disease characterized by proliferation and occlusion of small pulmonary arterioles, leading to progressive elevation of pulmonary artery pressure and pulmonary vascular resistance, and right ventricular failure.

L-phenylalanine catabolic process in children is much more heterogeneous than in adults, and can be associated with several genetic syndromes, congenital heart disease, pulmonary disease, and vascular disease.
